result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose David Rolon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Sex Registry Violation, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(6)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12/1/15 or a civil judgment to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

records.addlTxt: NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT
Defendant 's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($500.0) ad

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, pay the DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction with Huber for work only and 44 days credit; pay mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Jose David Rolon in court with attorney Gabriel William Houghton.  Defendant Jose David Rolon in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

On motion of the State, Court amends the Information to reflect the defendant is a/k/a Jose Rolon.

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.

Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court, defendant Jose David Rolon not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Gabriel William Houghton in court, defendant Jose David Rolon not in court, in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams for Jessica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Bail argued by counsel.  Court sets  bail at $10,000 cash.  

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Case set for return on warrant on 11-4-14 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 44.  Public defender's office notified for appointment of counsel./ds
No reply from defendant.

No appearance.     Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Court previously issued a bench warrant.  Defendant did not appear.  Bench warrant remains.
JusticePoint Discharge Summary received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

BRANCH 10 FOR BRANCH 12
Defendant Jose David Rolon not in court.  Joshua M Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant having absconded from JusticePoint, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue. Court ordered cash bond forfeited.  
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office.

14RM026397  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/19/2014

Defendant Jose David Rolon in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  
Defendant walked himself in today to address his bench warrant.  Arguments heard as to bail.   Court ordered cash bail set with TURN OVER TO JusticePoint.  All other conditions remain the same. Court ordered bench warrant canceled. Case is adjourned to Br 12.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-27-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) ad
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Jose David Rolon not in court. 
Deputy Court Clerk kmh.
ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. 
JusticePoint violation report received and filed.  Defendant left JusticePoint before the court could address this matter and has not been located.    The defendant having failed to comply with conditions of bail, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue. The court ordered any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.  Court vacated the plea/sentencing date of 6/27/2014.  Parties notified.

Defendant Walter David DeJesus in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CASE HEARD FOR BR. 12.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 
Defendant is not in compliance with registration.  Defense states that defendant has sent letter to DOC.
Case is adjourned to 6-27-2014 at 1:30 for plea/sentencing in Branch 12.
Atty Lockwood advises that the defendant's legal name is JOSE ROLON. Court directs that name is to be changed in CCAP.
JusticePoint report received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk kmh.

Defendant Walter David DeJesus in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Jesica Ballenger for Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
NO ADA OR DA FILE IN COURT.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski presiding.  Arraignment scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/9/14.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Walter David DeJesus in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Walter David DeJesus in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   
DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
